channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: BREAKING NEWS: Donald Trump's brother Robert hospitalized
item.description: White House officials on Friday confirmed President Trump's younger brother, Robert, 72, has been admitted to the hospital in New York. He was described as 'very ill', but his condition is unknown.

item.title: Barack Obama accuses Donald Trump of trying 'kneecap the Post Office' to discourage voting
item.description: Barack Obama slammed President Donald Trump for trying to 'actively kneecap' the postal service to disenfranchise voters.

item.title: 'Courageous' D-Day veteran John Hutton dies aged 96 one year after parachuting into France
item.description: John Hutton, known by his friends as Jock, was 19 when he served in the 13th Lancashire Parachute Battalion during the Second World War.
item.media:description: Veteran Jock Hutton after taking part in a commemorative parachute descent over Sannerville, France, during commemorations for the 75th anniversary of the D-Day landings (Gareth Fuller/PA)

item.title: Staycationers are urged NOT to travel with roads into Devon and Cornwall at a standstill
item.description: Police officers were reportedly in pursuit of a silver Mazda shortly after 2pm on Friday in response to an emergency call when it began travelling in the wrong direction down the A3 before crashing.

item.title: Second World War veteran who survived kamikaze attacks dies aged 94 just three days before VJ Day
item.description: Richard Edser, 94, from Harlow in Essex, survived kamikaze attacks on board the HMS Formidable aircraft carrier during his service in East Asia.
item.media:description: Richard Edser, 94, who served on the HMS Formidable, died on August 12 (Taxi Charity/PA)

item.title: 'Relieved' mother-of-two, 31, celebrates getting her driving licence after SEVENTEEN tests
item.description: Blessing Platinum-Williams was finally handed a pass last month after embarking on an intensive course in Watford at the start of lockdown.

item.title: Investigators will probe how Stonehaven rail crash went unnoticed due to poor phone signal
item.description: The ScotRail 6.38am service from Aberdeen to Glasgow derailed and slid down an embankment near Stonehaven between 6.53am and 9.40am on Wednesday.

item.title: 11 migrants rounded up by police near Dover town centre
item.description: Tony Benson, who lives in Lens, a large town 100km from Calais, said he 'wished the group luck' after he drove up to the French coast to give away the dinghy to people trying to reach the UK.

item.title: Boy, 2, dies after falling from ninth-floor east London flat
item.description: The toddler, thought to be aged two, fell around 4pm yesterday in Shoreditch, London, and was pronounced dead at the scene. Full circumstances surrounding the death are not yet known.

item.title: America's super rich throw parties and escape on private jets amid COVID-19
item.description: While the US continues to battle the highest number of cases globally and 1,000 Americans are dying a day, Silicon Valley's elite have been carrying on with their lives and socializing as if it was normal.

item.title: Cold Feet star James Nesbitt pays tribute to his father as he dies aged 91
item.description: The Northern Irish actor, 55, has described his late father as a wonderful parent, teacher and friend as he honoured him in a statement on Friday afternoon.

item.title: The SAGE files: Public toilets may drive Covid-19 spread and the term 'lockdown' should be BANNED
item.description: Scientists advising the British Government warned public toilets can become crowded and are likely to harbour the virus on numerous cold surfaces.

item.title: UK coronavirus: More deaths announced on Friday
item.description: Department of Health statistics show the daily spike in cases is the largest 24-hour jump since 1,514 people were diagnosed with the life-threatening disease on June 14.

item.title: Thousands of Seattle 'flu' cases may have been coronavirus
item.description: University of Texas, Austin research suggests that for every two cases of flu there was one of coronavirus. Of the 9,000 people they think had COVID-19 in Seattle, a third were likely children.

item.title: A-level student who played dead to survive 2014 Taliban massacre wins place at Oxford University
item.description: Ahmad Nawaz, 19, almost lost an arm when the Taliban unleashed fury at his school in Peshawar, Pakistan in December 2014.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper's mother talks of his legacy on anniversary
item.description: Pc Harper's family and Thames Valley Police officers gathered on Friday for services and a minute of silence. His mother Debbie Adlam attended a memorial in Berkshire, to mark the anniversary

item.title: 300lb woman shows off her body in crop tops and bikinis
item.description: Megan Fisher, 29, who lives in New York City, has never felt confident in her appearance, and spent years following fad diets to try and slim down.

item.title: Keir Starmer demands A-Level standardisation is DROPPED
item.description: The government is facing a storm after nearly 40 per cent of results were downgraded by the computer model deployed when exams had to be cancelled due to the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Couple who paid nearly £1,000 to beat quarantine deadline are among thousands forced to flee France
item.description: Thousands of UK holidays have been dashed as panicked Brits desperate to avoid having to self-isolate for 14 days from France flee the European country.

item.title: John Lewis's flagship £35million store in Birmingham will never reopen after closing during lockdown
item.description: The high-end brand has confirmed all eight retail sites announced in July as at risk of closure, including the Grand Central store in Birmingham and its Watford branch, will never reopen.

item.title: Pictured: Churchgoer, 26, known as Gucci for his love of fashion label who was shot dead by gunman
item.description: Jeffrey Wegbe, 26, was found with a gunshot wound to his chest at the property in Kilburn, north west London on Wednesday morning. There have been no arrests.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Sandwich factory open despite 300 infections
item.description: Greencore, the UK's largest maker of pre-packed sandwiches, has said that production is 'continuing as usual' at the plant and it had no concerns about its products.

item.title: Pop-up market breaching 800-year-old law can continue to trade
item.description: Council have made a dramatic u-turn on their decision to ban Sileby market because of medieval law. Now five stalls will be allowed every Tuesday as that 'would not constitute a market'.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon causes holiday chaos for thousands by DEMANDING France is put on quarantine list
item.description: Eurostar has warned that many travellers may not be able to get back to the UK after the Prime Minister made the eleventh hour decision to add France to the UK's quarantine list.

item.title: Michael Cohen seen after bombshell details from book revealed
item.description: DailyMail.com spotted Michael Cohen in New York City on Friday, the day after he published a sneak of 'Disloyal' - his upcoming memoir about his years-long relationship with Donald Trump.

item.title: Coronavirus: The more people know about COVID-19 the less pandemic-related stress they have
item.description: Researchers from the Ohio State University found that learning more about the virus helped people reduce their feelings of uncertainty - which reduced their stress.

item.title: Hero who smashed car window to save distressed dog in heatwave says he 'knew he had to act'
item.description: Axe-wielding hero William Morris was seen saving a dog from a stranger's car at the Newbury Retail Park in Berkshire on Monday afternoon by smashing the window in a now-viral video.

item.title: Man, 21, arrested after pensioner found dead in Shropshire
item.description: Early on Friday police discovered the body of a man, in his 70s, on Brown Clee Hill in South Shropshire.

item.title: Grand Designs presenter Kevin McCloud's housing firm at risk
item.description: Grand Designs host Kevin McCloud, pictured, launched Happiness Architecture Beauty (HAB) in 2007 'to make homes that lift the spirits'. He has written to investors to say their money is at risk.

item.title: Man gets revenge on fly-tipper who dumped 400 tyres on his land
item.description: A farmer plagued by a fly-tipper who dumped 421 tyres on his land got his own back - after placing them in a truck and depositing them back on HIS doorstep

item.title: Man says travellers forced him into Tesco baby food blackmail
item.description: Nigel Wright, 45 is on trial at the Old Bailey for allegedly trying to extort nearly £1.5 million in cryptocurrency from the supermarket chain because he was angry at being underpaid for milk.

item.title: Julian Assange's lawyers 'astonished' by new US charges
item.description: The US Government made a fresh extradition request to have the WikiLeaks founder sent from the UK based on charges in a new superseding indictment.

item.title: Turkey accuses France of 'bullying' after Macron sent navy to Mediterranean
item.description: Tensions in the Mediterranean have risen since Turkey sent a seismic vessel and a small navy fleet into the region on Monday (pictured, French and Greek ships in the Mediterranean).

item.title: Second emu is on the loose in Doncaster
item.description: Residents in Sprotbrough, near Doncaster, South Yorkshire, shared pictures and videos of the large bird wondering around fields near the A1.

item.title: Spring will be a 'new dawn' for Britain, says deputy chief medical officer
item.description: Professor Van Tam, the deputy chief medical officer for England, said the development of a working vaccine against Covid-19 could start to have an impact on daily life by Easter 2021.

item.title: Coronavirus: Cough detection camera could track symptoms
item.description: Korean researchers have created software that can help hospital workers track patients and their cough symptoms during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Lightning strikes a palm tree on a clear day in Florida video
item.description: The unusual footage, referred to as a 'Bolt from the Blue' by meteorologists was captured from the inside of a Florida man's car, while he was around 75ft away from the strike.

item.title: Bomb disposal team are called to Sellafield nuclear site after explosive chemical discovered
item.description: Bomb disposal experts cleared Sellafield nuclear site in Cumbria after organic peroxide was found during a routine inspection.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon's pandemic: From gazumping ministers to using Westminster cash to boost popularity
item.description: The SNP leader has consistently out-maneuvered Boris Johnson's Government during the coronavirus pandemic but finds herself in hot water over France quarantine.

item.title: Boy abducted by woman in broad daylight in China is rescued
item.description: Chilling surveillance footage shows a woman speaking to the lost youngster before scooping him up in China's southern city Guangdong. The suspect has been detained.

item.title: Brazilian president Jair Bolosonaro's approval rating hits its highest ever amid Covid-19 crisis
item.description: A poll found that 37% of those surveyed viewed Bolsonaro's government as great or good - up from 32% in June. His rejection dropped to 34% viewing his government as bad or terrible.

item.title: Lanarkshire NHS board's transitioners' policy was 'unlawful'
item.description: Sarah Phillimore, 49, from London, criticised NHS Lanarkshire over their 'Supporting Trans Staff in the Workplace policy', which relates to female shared toilet, shower and changing room facilities.

item.title: Losing weight before middle age 'can halve death risk'
item.description: Reductions in body mass index between these two life stages is critical to extending lifespan, US researchers reveal.

item.title: 'Pro-Russian' paedophile, 54, sent letter to Theresa May containing fake poison
item.description: Dr Christopher Doyle, 54, sparked a counter-terrorism investigation when he posted an envelope containing white powder to Westminster. He denied adding the fake poison himself.

item.title: Divorcee is awarded Russian billionaire ex-husband's £340m superyacht and £110m art collection
item.description: Tatiana Akhmedova, who lives in London, was awarded a 41.5% share of businessman Farkhad Akhmedov's £1 billion-plus fortune by a British judge in late 2016 but has so far only received £5 million

item.title: 'Superman' father leaps to stop a falling full-body mirror from smashing into his toddler daughter
item.description: CCTV footage has captured the heart-stopping moment the full-body glass mirror suddenly tipped over before being stopped in mid-air by the parent who leapt across the living room in China.

item.title: Two revellers dive into waterfall and disappear from sight to find themselves in pitch black cave
item.description: Frederic Esnault and Tshawe Bagwa, from Norway, were visiting the jungle around Port Antonio, Jamaica when they found a waterfall that flowed down into a hole in the rock.

item.title: Twin sisters married to twin brothers are both PREGNANT
item.description: Twins Brittany and Briana Deane, 33, married identical brothers Josh and Jeremy Salyers, 35, in a double wedding in 2018. Now both couples are expecting babies at the same time.

item.title: Spain bans smoking in public nationwide and closes restaurants and bars
item.description: Spain's Health Minister Salvador Illa unveiled new measures to be enforced nationwide, including banning smoking in the street and closing discos, as the country's Covid-19 cases continue to rise.

item.title: Teenage traveller, 17, named after Rocky Marciano is jailed for life
item.description: Rocky Marciano Price, 17, has been sentenced at Preston Crown Court to life for the murder of Lindsay Birbeck, 47, and must serve a minimum of 16 years in custody.

item.title: Hero builder saves stranded dolphin after he heard it whistling at him while stuck in riverbed
item.description: Leon De Sola Pinto turned up to his building site on the banks of Helford River in Cornwall on August 10 and heard clicks coming from the river where he saw a dolphin stranded and needing help.

item.title: Puppies who mingle are less likely to be scared of fireworks and thunder
item.description: Pet owners in Finland were asked to fill out a questionnaire on their dog and ny anxiety-related behavioural problems the pet has and how they react to certain stimuli.

item.title: Social media 'doesn't increase mental health problems in teens'
item.description: In a study of 74,000 teens between 13 and 16 years old, US researchers found no association between depression symptoms and social media use.

item.title: France vows to retaliate with quarantine against British travellers
item.description: Emmanuel Macron's transport minister said France 'regrets the UK's decision' and 'will apply reciprocal measures' after people crossing the Channel were ordered to isolate for 14 days.

item.title: Comedian Russell Howard storms out of gig just five minutes
item.description: The comedian noticed the woman in the audience filming him, while he was performing new material, about five minutes into the set on the outdoor terrace of the Bambalan bar in Bristol.

item.title: Warning over rising Covid-19 cases in locked-down Calderdale
item.description: Public Health England announced Newark and Sherwood, home to around 120,000 people, is now an 'area of concern'. It was one of 29 areas named on the watchlist.

item.title: Smartphone customizer unveils SpaceX-themed iPhone with Elon Musk's signature for nearly $6,000
item.description: Caviar is accepting pre-orders for its 'Musk be one Mars' SpaceX-themed iPhone 12 that pays tribute to Elon Musk and includes a small piece of the Dragon capsule on the titanium backing.

item.title: Renewable biogas from COW MANURE is injected into the UK Grid
item.description: The biomethane connected to the Gas National Transmission System at the end of July by anaerobic digestion company BioCow from a farm in Cambridgeshire.

item.title: July rise in Covid-19 cases in England has 'levelled off' again, data shows
item.description: Today's report from the Office for National Statistics said a rise in coronavirus cases in July has now 'levelled off' again and there is no evidence that the virus is surging in England.

item.title: Police arrest two men after 29-year-old man dies suddenly
item.description: Two men have been arrested after a man's body was recovered from Brassmil Lane in Bath, pictured. The 29-year-old victim was found dead on Thursday afternoon.

item.title: Just Eat will stop using gig economy workers to deliver food, firm's boss says
item.description: Jitse Groen, chief executive of the food delivery giant, revealed he would prefer to give his staff more benefits in light of the difficulties they have faced since the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Double knockout as skateboarder falls off and second racer piles into him and they hit the dirt
item.description: The horror crash was at a hill bombing event in San Francisco resulting in two skateboarders going to hospital after one falls off his board and is unable to move out of the way of a second boarder.

item.title: Ministers quietly remove 1.3million coronavirus tests from their official figures
item.description: The double-counted tests were added between May 14 and August 12, but the total number of tests 'made available' before and after the adjustment is unclear.

item.title: Thai king commutes death sentence for Myanmar men in British tourist murder case
item.description: Two migrants from Myanmar on death row in Thailand for the murder of two British backpackers had their sentences commuted to life in prison. Zaw Lin and Win Zaw Htun were sentenced.

item.title: Global warming: Greenland glaciers pass 'point of no return'
item.description: Experts from the US used nearly 40 years of satellite data to show that even were global warming to stop today, the ice sheets would keep shrinking for some time.

item.title: California ranks fifth in the world for COVID-19 cases
item.description: The number of infections in California, the most populous US state, reached 597,984 on Friday morning, according to a John Hopkins tally.

item.title: Pest controllers warn warm weather 'accelerated' growth of wasps
item.description: Norfolk pest controller Andrew Dellbridge, 51, said high temperatures early on has 'accelerated the growth of the insect population' and warned activity 'can only get worse in the next few weeks'.

item.title: Ex-soldier founds Zimbabwe's female-only anti-poaching tribe
item.description: The Akashinga anti-poaching unit was founded by Australian ex-special forces soldier Damien Mander, who uses his experience serving in Iraq to train women to protect Zimbabwe's wildlife.

item.title: Kenya's elephant numbers have more than doubled since 1989
item.description: The number of elephants in Kenya has soared to more than 34,000 as of 2018, officials said

item.title: Head of firm handed £150m coronavirus face-mask contract blasts 'fake' news that the did not work
item.description: Tim Horlick said that 50 million Chinese-made FFP2 masks supplied by Ayanda Capital were 'perfectly good' and accused civil servants of an unwarranted attack on the business.

item.title: Mother cures twin boys' eczema with £5 'magic' moisturiser cure
item.description: Mother Charlotte Moreton, 28, from York, was delighted after discovering 'magic' moisturiser cure which instantly solved the eczema of her 11-month-old twins Tommy and Conan.

item.title: Covid-19 cases could be missed because temperatures are more common in the evening than the morning
item.description: Researchers concluded that up to half of people who have a fever may be missed, and said this would apply to other infectious diseases like Covid-19 after studying flu patients in Boston.

item.title: Wild boar that stole German nudist's clothes could be killed in part of cull
item.description: Photos of the female boar and her two young were shared thousands of times on social media after a naked sunbather was snapped unashamedly chasing after them to retrieve his laptop bag.

item.title: All the ways you can get back to UK from France by 4am tomorrow (but it will cost you!)
item.description: Tourists have piled onto trains, planes and cars as they try to get back to the UK from France before the country is added to the quarantine list at 4am on Saturday.

item.title: Gymshark valued at £1bn as US investment firm bids for 20pc stake
item.description: Ben Francis, pictured, started his Gymshark brand in his parents' garage in Birmingham. After decade in business, the firm is now worth an estimated £1bn. Last

item.title: NASA shares stunning photos of Mars captured by its Reconnaissance Orbiter
item.description: Images were all taken of the Red Planet and its surroundings from space using equipment onboard the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter - which is the oldest spacecraft currently active around Mars.

item.title: Students face paying £150 to appeal A-level results
item.description: Thousands of teenagers up and down the country have been left in despair after missing out on university places after their exam results were marked down.

item.title: Woman reveals her friend asked her to take a day off WORK to watch a live stream of her wedding
item.description: A British woman has taken to Mumsnet to reveal that her friend has asked her to take a day off work to tune into a live stream of her intimate wedding. The post has divided option online.

item.title: Woman poses for provocative butt photo while surrounded by kids
item.description: A video of the wannabe model striking a seductive pose in the pool was shared on the @influencersinthewild TikTok account this week.

item.title: Holly H, the UK's biggest TikTok star who earns £60k per ad
item.description: Britain's biggest TikTok star Holly H, 23, Sussex, has opened up about her life as the platform's most popular user on This Morning, and told her followers worry about her if she doesn't upload videos.

item.title: Venice activists hold party to celebrate cruise lines pulling out
item.description: MSC Cruises and Costa Cruises announced this week that their first Mediterranean trips after a months-long hiatus due to the coronavirus pandemic would depart from Genoa and Trieste.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon 'insisted on early deadline for France quarantine'
item.description: The new rules on isolating for 14 days will take effect for anyone who arrives in the UK from 4am tomorrow, sparking a desperate stamped to get home by thousands of British holidaymakers.

item.title: Prince William wishes Child Bereavement trustee the 'best of luck'
item.description: Prince William, 38, appeared on the charity's Instagram page in a short message where he wished the 'best of luck' to trustee Alexander Fitzgibbons, who is embarking on a journey to raise money.

item.title: An extraordinary account of how a Welsh and American team conquered Afghanistan's highest peak
item.description: As tough climbs go, there are few more gruelling than getting to the top of 24,580ft Mount Noshaq - the highest mountain in Afghanistan. As Welshman James Bingham and his team discovered.

item.title: Iran condemns Trump's Middle East peace deal
item.description: Iran, in the ministry statement, called the normalizing of ties between the two countries a dangerous, 'shameful' measure on Friday.

item.title: Couple renovating home at breaking point and £40K down after rogue builder leaves it uninhabitable
item.description: Mother-of-two Charlotte Rudolph, 41, from Bath, and her partner Sam Peacock told FEMAIL they have rented four-and-a-half years and purchased their 'forever home' in January for £287,500.

item.title: UK-financed projects in Scotland will fly a Union flag as Boris Johnson battles independence drive
item.description: Boris Johnson wants the emblem to be included in the same way that European Union flags were included on infrastructure and other schemes paid for in whole or part via Brussels' cash.

item.title: Man, 26, is charged with murdering pensioner, 74
item.description: Cameron St Rose, 26, of Forest Gate in London was charged with David Brickwood's murder. The 74-year-old scrap metal dealer was attacked at his home in Northampton in September 2015.

item.title: Public Health England still hasn't pinpointed 30,000 duplicated test results in coronavirus count
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Data published by Public Health England still includes people who were tested twice, some of whom may have been diagnosed before going into hospital and then again after.

item.title: Eating disorder charity reports 50% increase in calls during 'Lose a Stone in 21 Days'
item.description: Presenter Dr Mosley says the program, that restricts participants to 800 calories a day, is to 'get our health back on track' after lockdown. But Beat had to extend their helpline hours during the show.

item.title: Pair of cubs sneak into back yard to battle in paddling pool and is filmed by California homeowner
item.description: The adorable bears were spotted in South Lake Tahoe, California, going for a swim in a pool in someone's yard in footage taken on August 11. The cubs play fight and splash around in the water.

item.title: Britons race to beauty salons after Boris Johnson announced they can reopen TOMORROW
item.description: Customers today are scrambling to book appointments over the weekend after Boris Johnson gave beauty salons the green light to reopen.

item.title: As the BBC's The Fall airs again on Netflix, first-time viewers go wild for Jamie Dornan's character
item.description: Fans of BBC's The Fall are managing to ignore the horror of serial killer Paul Spector's crimes, to swoon over actor Jamie Dornan. The thriller is proving hugely popular once again after airing on Netflix.

item.title: Oxford warns students who appeal downgraded A-level they WON'T be eligible for a place this year
item.description: Some students who achieve the top grades after challenging their results could have their places at Oxford deferred until autumn 2021.

item.title: Black DJ fears she was racially profiled by her neighbours
item.description: Kaylee Golding, 22, who has presented for BBC Radio 1's Early Breakfast, had only just moved from Birmingham into the flat in Newham, east London, ten days earlier when the officers turned up.

item.title: Ministers accused of 'losing control' of immigration as cash handouts act as 'no lose pull factor'
item.description: Migration Watch UK said only a tiny minority of those who arrived illegally by boat have been removed since Prime Minister Boris Johnson warned last August: 'We will send you back.'

item.title: Textile fibres can be transferred between clothing in the absence of contact
item.description: Under small, compact and semi-enclosed spaces, such as in an elevator, contactless transfer of fibres between garments can be possible through airborne travel.

item.title: ANOTHER day of thunderstorms: Britain is braced for travel chaos, road closures and power cuts
item.description: From today through to Monday there will be a constant deluge of rainfall working its way from the south of England up to Wales and as far north as Hull as Britons are lashed with up to 70mm of rain.

item.title: Power of the atomic bomb is shown in colourised photos 75 years after 146,000 died in Hiroshima
item.description: Student Anju Niwata, 18, and her Tokyo University professor Hidenori Watanave have colourised pictures of Hiroshima using artificial intelligence 75 years after the US bomb was dropped.

item.title: 'Neo-Nazi' Met Police officer, 22, appears in court for being 'member of far-right terror group'
item.description: A serving Met Police officer has appeared in court charged with being a member of far-right terror group National Action, fraud and possessing an indecent image of a child

item.title: CEO Linda Plant says a return to work is needed to 'keep Britain great'
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: In an article written for FEMAIL, Leeds-born CEO Linda Plant, best known as a fearsome interviewer on BBC's The Apprentice, is encouraging employees to stop working from home.

item.title: Cyclist Tim Declercq shows off bruises after being caught in hailstorm
item.description: Professional cyclist Tim Leclerq has shown off the gruesome bruises left behind by giant hailstones after a storm battered stage two of the Criterium du Dauphine in France.

item.title: Russia fights to stop an outbreak of bubonic plague by vaccinating 32,000 people
item.description: Bubonic plague has been detected in Siberia including an area where it has not been seen since monitoring began 62 years ago. The rush to vaccinate comes after two deaths in Mongolia.

item.title: Have YOU hit a weightloss plateau? Nutritionist reveals why your diet has stopped working
item.description: Tamara Willner, a British nutritionist at the NHS-backed healthy eating plan Second Nature, reveals why you shouldn't give up if you hit a plateau - and how to kickstart your weight loss again.

item.title: Science Editor-in-Chief warns against 'dangerous rush' to find a Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: Holden Thorp, editor-in-chief of the Science journals, urges politicians against cutting corners just days after Russian leader Vladimir Putin claimed his country created a jab.

item.title: Amazon driver urinates against garage of woman who lost her partner to coronavirus
item.description: The delivery driver was seen urinating against the garage of Sarah Merrix, 44, of Portsmouth, who lost her partner, Dom Merrix, 48, in April, and has a ten-year-old daughter.

item.title: Restaurant boss is left stunned after receiving more than 800 applicants for 15 new roles
item.description: Wayne Chadwick, owner of York Roast Co, said it used to be difficult to recruit staff, but he has been inundated with hundreds of applications after posting 15 job openings online.

item.title: US report concludes that 'maintenance' of warehouse caused huge Beirut ammonium nitrate explosion
item.description: It comes amid speculation over what could have triggered the deadly chemical blast which killed 171 people.

item.title: Thousands of students ignore social distancing to celebrate their Covid-hit A-level results
item.description: Thousands of students were out celebrating their A-Level results or drowning their sorrows last night after a government algorithm marked down 40 per cent of grades.

item.title: British tourist, 30, falls 500ft from a cliff to his death in popular Ibiza beauty spot
item.description: A Liverpool man, named locally as Richard Lloyd Canavan, 30, died instantly after falling nearly 500 feet from cliffs near a lookout point at Cala d'Hort on Ibiza's south coast.

item.title: First official portrait of Captain Sir Tom Moore unveiled ahead of the 75th anniversary of VJ Day
item.description: The first official portrait of Captain Sir Tom Moore has been unveiled at the National Army Museum in Chelsea ahead of the 75th anniversary of Victory in Japan Day tomorrow.

item.title: Russian mercenary leader's 99 calls to Putin revealed
item.description: Calls revealed by Bellingcat show that restaurateur and suspected Wagner mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin was in regular contact with Russia's elite.

item.title: Student, 21, drops 220lbs after swapping fast food for 'unseasoned potatoes'
item.description: Dylan Wall, 21, from Dixon County, Tennessee, weighed 425lbs when he graduated from high school in 2017. He decided to change his life after he couldn't keep up with a college tour.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell is in isolation for her own safety fed prosecutors say
item.description: Maxwell's lawyers say she is being subjected to round-the-clock surveillance and 'onerous' body scans at the Brooklyn jail despite no longer being on suicide watch.

item.title: Mike Tyson issues fierce warning to Roy Jones Jr during intense new promo ahead of clash
item.description: The 54-year-old is set to fight Jones in an eight-round exhibition on November 28. In the fight's latest promo video, Tyson said he is an 'annihilator' in a fierce warning to Jones.

item.title: Mother, 29, was left wheelchair-bound after her coccyx SNAPPED OFF when she tombstoned off waterfall
item.description: Danni Harding, 29, had travelled 45 miles with her friends to the Sgwd Gwladys waterfall in Pontneddfechan, Glynneath, where she hit a rock in the water during the accident in 2018.

item.title: Football fans won't be allowed to sing or chant when they return to stadiums next month
item.description: Fans will have to take responsibility by agreeing to rules on behaviour before they're allowed inside stadiums again and that is likely to include a ban on singing and chanting.

item.title: Asda scam warning: Facebook-based phishing attack lures victims with '£1,000 gift card offer'
item.description: Asda shoppers are warned to be wary of the sophisticated phishing scam, which was first identified by the UK litigation practice Griffin Law.

item.title: Student who revised for her exams while having chemotherapy for stage three cancer passes A Levels
item.description: Kira O'Connor Fitzgerald, 18, of Swindon, Wiltshire, was diagnosed with stage three Hodgkin lymphoma - an uncommon blood cancer - just after she started sixth form.

item.title: Dubai's ruling elite face £1bn lawsuit over claims property developer was 'robbed' of £500m business
item.description: It is alleged that figures including Sheikh Mohammed bin Khalifa bin Saeed al-Maktoum (pictured), the cousin of UAE's PM, conspired to defraud Mohammed Haddad of his business.

item.title: Holidaymaker gives a £750 caravan bought on Facebook Marketplace a modern makeover for under £200
item.description: Vicky Hibberd, 25, from Stoke on Trent, bought a caravan on Facebook Marketplace for £750. She then gave it a new lease life using Frenchic paints and accessories from B&M and The Range.

item.title: Greater Manchester mayor urges against Oldham lockdown after a spike in coronavirus cases
item.description: Andy Burnham called on the Government not to bring in 'knee-jerk measures' as coronavirus cases continue to rise in some boroughs of Greater Manchester.

item.title: British women share their most shocking sexist encounters during lockdown
item.description: Instagram account cutecatcalls has documented the shocking cases of sexism experienced by women across Britain.

item.title: People in Wales will be able to see more of their families and friends from August 22
item.description: Up to four households should be able to meet in Wales from August 22, should Covid-19 rates remain stable over the next week.

item.title: Tiny mammal escapes the clutches of a heron after an extraordinary two-minute struggle
item.description: A hungry heron hunted a tiny weasel in Peterhead, Aberdeenshire, Scotland, but was forced to drop the mammal when it twisted its way around and bit the bird on its face, leaving it damaged.

item.title: Award winning wildlife photographer captures the world's fiercest animals in breath-taking portraits
item.description: Photographer Andrey Gudkov, from Russia, told BoredPanda his passion for wildlife photography was inspired by watching Sir David Attenborough documentaries during his childhood.

item.title: Stoke-on-Trent dog groomer is accused of fraud after getting £240,000 in coronavirus grant mix-up
item.description: Amy Osborne, 22, of Parkhall, Stoke-on-Trent, in Staffordshire, saw her bank balance swell overnight by £3,000 and then £237,000 after she applied for Government support during lockdown.

item.title: Mother of eleven who has spent almost a decade being pregnant says she's desperate for more children
item.description: Britni Church, 31, from Arkansas City, Kansas, had her fist child aged 16 and is now mother to 11 children including one-year-old triplets - but says she still wants more.

item.title: Domino's launch BOTTLES of its iconic garlic and herb dip sauce FOR FREE
item.description: Lucky fans will no longer have to scrimp on their favourite condiment, with the 320ml Drizzler bottles of Domino's iconic garlic and herb dip up for grabs from today.

item.title: SUV sideswipes approaching van causing it to veer into oncoming traffic and miss pickup truck
item.description: Footage shows a red SUV turning left across traffic and going into the outside lane in Piedmont, Oklahoma. A red van was already occupying that lane and as SUV crashes into its side.

item.title: Kelly Brook reveals she's been called 'past her best' and 'unsexy' by cruel trolls
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Kelly Brook, of Kent, reflected about her weight 'creeping up' while in lockdown thanks to boredom - admitting she now wants to slim back down to a 'healthy' size 10 or 12.

item.title: UK buys 90million doses of two more promising coronavirus vaccines
item.description: British officials have agreed deals with the US-based pharmaceutical companies Johnson & Johnson and Novavax to trial and develop their Covid-19 vaccines.

item.title: Racist hipster, 45, attacked two nightclub bouncers for having short 'p**i' beards
item.description: Damian Swain, 45, went berserk after objecting to shorter facial hair sported by bouncers Ryan Wightman and Chris Badawed outside a club in Stalybridge, Greater Manchester.

item.title: Bon appétit! Diners share the hilarious snaps of the moment requests were executed VERY literally
item.description: Diners from around the world have been sharing the hilarious snaps of the moment they received their orders which had been executed very literally by restaurant and cafe staff.

item.title: Paddleboarders found clinging to a lobster pot 17 miles out to sea after a 15-hour search
item.description: Sara Feeney, 23, and Ellen Glynn, 17, were found near Inisheer, Ireland, yesterday, 17 miles from where they had set off. Ellen's father Johnny said he did not expect to find them alive.

item.title: Tricky language quiz tests your knowledge of obscure new additions to the Oxford English Dictionary
item.description: A tricky challenge created by Anna Claro for US-based trivia website Playbuzz is putting the internet's knowledge of the English language to the test with phrases found in the Oxford Dictionary.

item.title: Landlords must reveal if tenants affected by coronavirus if trying to evict them
item.description: New measures mean that the process of gaining possession of their property via the courts will not be the same as before the pandemic.

item.title: Tricky brainteaser challenges puzzlers to spot the Devon-style scone with the cream before the jam
item.description: The puzzle, created by UK-based company Leisure Cookers, shows Cornish-style scones, with just a single Devon version hiding somewhere within the colourful scene.

item.title: Healthy Mummy home cooks are obsessing over a simple recipe for a Mexican lasagne
item.description: Australian home cooks are obsessing over a Mexican-inspired healthy lasagne recipe, with many saying it's the ultimate 'crowd pleaser'.

item.title: Bison drags woman around unconscious before ripping off her pants after she came too close to a calf
item.description: An Iowa biker got off her motorcycle and approached a buffalo calf in Custer State Park in South Dakota. The adult bison then came charging after her and threw her to the ground.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... the Sussexes finding freedom
item.description: 'I do love Balmoral - but I wonder if Harry's new mansion has a granny wing?'

item.title: Joe Biden leads Donald Trump by seven points nationwide, poll shows
item.description: Biden is leading Trump by seven points nationwide as new poll reveals more than 50 per cent of respondents disapprove of the president's handling of the coronavirus pandemic and other top issues.

item.title: Single radio producer Jana Hocking, 36, reveals why she always dates MULTIPLE men at once
item.description: A single Australian radio producer has revealed why women should date multiple men at once, explaining that it will reduce your chances of a 'broken heart' in the long run.

item.title: Black Irish woman shares video of unprovoked racist abuse
item.description: In the unprovoked racist attack, a white man crosses the road in Galway and aggressively shouts the n-word at the woman in broad daylight.

item.title: Flytippers dump mountain of junk on 4,000-year-old Bronze Age burial ground in Wales
item.description: Visitors to the home of a 4000-year-old Bronze Age burial mound in Wales were shocked to find it trashed with mounds of rubbish including sofas, kitchen appliances and rotting food.

item.title: Fly-tippers forced to load rubbish BACK ONTO their lorry
item.description: James Johnston, from Glasgow, spotted the two men dumping planks of wood and other debris in his field and insisted that they remove it straight away. The men reloaded the debris into a van.
